result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlisa J Chatman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 9/5/2014.
**9/3/2014 Hearing cancelled and removed from Court's calendar.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC during period of Extended supervision or Civil judgment.  Bail to apply.  No DV surcharge.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.  Credit for 79 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact unless approved by Children's Court,  father and agent.  No babysitting or supervision or discipline of children.
No firearms; weapons.

Successfully complete anger management, and continued programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Cooperate with CHIPS and Children's Court.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may not possess a firearm or body armor; also that her voting rights  are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one. Credit for zero days.

Order on Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations; signed, filed, and distributed. 
THE COURT ORDERS:
Court Financial Obligations: Judgment is granted against the Defendant for other unpaid Court ordered financial obligations in the amount of $190.76.
The Clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee. Interest will be added from the date of entry of judgment at the rate allowed by statute. 

THIS IS A FINAL ORDER FOR THE PURPOSE OF APPEAL.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arlisa J Chatman in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Parties reviewed PSI report.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), with credit for 79 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact unless approved by Children's Court, 
   father and agent.    
   No babysitting or supervision or discipline of children.  
   May not be unsupervised with any children.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   Cash bail to apply.  No DV surcharge. 
* Cooperate with CHIPS and Children's Court.    
*  Court ordered Restitution Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-5-2014 AT 8:30 AM. 
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing Referral Form.
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

14RM031978  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/25/2014
PLEA HEARING

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #3 and #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   PSI (without recommendation) ordered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-18-2014 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Arlisa J Chatman in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Amended Information, received and filed.
"On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Child Abuse Reckless Probab/Great Harm, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 948.03(3)(c) and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony."   mld

Attorney David K Ziemer in court, defendant Arlisa J Chatman not in court, in custody.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-28-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney David K Ziemer in court, defendant Arlisa J Chatman not in court, in custody.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. All discovery turned over to defense counsel, and offer will be forthcoming, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 04 on 5-6-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PAC (11/8/09).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Arlisa J Chatman in court with attorney Joan E Zawikowski.  Defendant Arlisa J Chatman in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.   Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case originally tabbed to Judge Dallet.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
